docs.text: Cinder Theme Specimen Typography Typefaces Headers: Inter Body: Open Sans Code: Hack Body Copy You think water moves fast? You should see ice. It moves like it has a mind . Like it knows it killed the world once and got a taste for murder. After the avalanche, it took us a week to climb out . Now, I don't know exactly when we turned on each other, but I know that seven of us survived the slide... and only five made it out. Now we took an oath, that I'm breaking now. We said we'd say it was the snow that killed the other two, but it wasn't. Nature is lethal but it doesn't hold a candle to man. Like inline code? Here is a string for you 010101010 . Lead Body Copy Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum faucibus dolor auctor. Duis mollis, est non commodo luctus. Headings All HTML headings, <h1> through <h6> , are available. .h1 through .h6 classes are also available, for when you want to match the font styling of a heading but still want your text to be displayed inline. h1. Heading h2. Heading h3. Heading h4. Heading h5. Heading h6. Heading h1. Heading Secondary text h2. Heading Secondary text h3. Heading Secondary text h4. Heading Secondary text h5. Heading Secondary text h6. Heading Secondary text Blockquotes Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer posuere erat a ante. Code Inline Code This is an example of inline code #import requests Preformatted Code Blocks with Syntax Highlighting def request(method, url, **kwargs): """Constructs and sends a :class:`Request `. Usage:: >>> import requests >>> req = requests.request('GET', 'https://httpbin.org/get') """ # By using the 'with' statement we are sure the session is closed, thus we # avoid leaving sockets open which can trigger a ResourceWarning in some # cases, and look like a memory leak in others. with sessions.Session() as session: return session.request(method=method, url=url, **kwargs) def get(url, params=None, **kwargs): r"""Sends a GET request. :param url: URL for the new :class:`Request` object. :param params: (optional) Dictionary, list of tuples or bytes to send in the body of the :class:`Request`. :param \*\*kwargs: Optional arguments that ``request`` takes. :return: :class:`Response ` object :rtype: requests.Response """ kwargs.setdefault('allow_redirects', True) return request('get', url, params=params, **kwargs) def request(method, url, **kwargs): """Constructs and sends a :class:`Request `. Usage:: >>> import requests >>> req = requests.request('GET', 'https://httpbin.org/get') """ # By using the 'with' statement we are sure the session is closed, thus we # avoid leaving sockets open which can trigger a ResourceWarning in some # cases, and look like a memory leak in others. with sessions.Session() as session: return session.request(method=method, url=url, **kwargs) def get(url, params=None, **kwargs): r"""Sends a GET request. :param url: URL for the new :class:`Request` object. :param params: (optional) Dictionary, list of tuples or bytes to send in the body of the :class:`Request`. :param \*\*kwargs: Optional arguments that ``request`` takes. :return: :class:`Response ` object :rtype: requests.Response """ kwargs.setdefault('allow_redirects', True) return request('get', url, params=params, **kwargs) (Source code sample from the Python requests library , Apache License, v2.0 ) Syntax highlighting support is available for and of the following languages listed on the highlightjs website . See the mkdocs "styling your docs" hljs_languages section for info on how to load languages dynamically. Note Include source code formatted in Github-flavored Markdown fenced code blocks with an info string that defines the supported programming language to automate syntax highlighting when your site is built. It moves like it has a mind . Like it knows it killed the world once and got a taste for murder. After the avalanche, it took us a week to climb out . Now, I don't know exactly when we turned on each other, but I know that seven of us survived the slide... and only five made it out. Now we took an oath, that I'm breaking now. We said we'd say it was the snow that killed the other two, but it wasn't. Nature is lethal but it doesn't hold a candle to man. Like inline code? Here is a string for you 010101010 . Code ¶ 代码 Inline Code ¶ 内联代码 This is an example of inline code #import requests Preformatted Code Blocks with Syntax Highlighting 预格式化代码块 带高亮显示 def request (method, url, **kwargs) : """Constructs and sends a :class:`Request `. Usage:: >>> import requests >>> req = requests.request('GET', 'https://httpbin.org/get') """ # By using the 'with' statement we are sure the session is closed, thus we # avoid leaving sockets open which can trigger a ResourceWarning in some # cases, and look like a memory leak in others. with sessions.Session() as session: return session.request(method=method, url=url, **kwargs) def get (url, params=None, **kwargs) : r"""Sends a GET request. :param url: URL for the new :class:`Request` object. :param params: (optional) Dictionary, list of tuples or bytes to send in the body of the :class:`Request`. :param \*\*kwargs: Optional arguments that ``request`` takes. :return: :class:`Response ` object :rtype: requests.Response """ kwargs.setdefault( 'allow_redirects' , True ) return request( 'get' , url, params=params, **kwargs) (Source code sample from the Python requests library , Apache License, v2.0 ) Syntax highlighting support is available for and of the following languages listed on the highlightjs website . See the mkdocs "styling your docs" hljs_languages section for info on how to load languages dynamically. Note Include source code formatted in Github-flavored Markdown fenced code blocks with an info string that defines the supported programming language to automate syntax highlighting when your site is built. docs.text: def request (method, url, **kwargs) : """Constructs and sends a :class:`Request `. Usage:: >>> import requests >>> req = requests.request('GET', 'https://httpbin.org/get') """ # By using the 'with' statement we are sure the session is closed, thus we # avoid leaving sockets open which can trigger a ResourceWarning in some # cases, and look like a memory leak in others. with sessions.Session() as session: return session.request(method=method, url=url, **kwargs) def get (url, params=None, **kwargs) : r"""Sends a GET request. :param url: URL for the new :class:`Request` object. :param params: (optional) Dictionary, list of tuples or bytes to send in the body of the :class:`Request`. :param \*\*kwargs: Optional arguments that ``request`` takes. :return: :class:`Response ` object :rtype: requests.Response """ kwargs.setdefault( 'allow_redirects' , True ) return request( 'get' , url, params=params, **kwargs) (Source code sample from the Python requests library , Apache License, v2.0 ) Syntax highlighting support is available for and of the following languages listed on the highlightjs website . docs.text: 关于使用esp32c3 在 Arduino|文件|首选项|其他开发板管理器地址 中填入 https://espressif.github.io/arduino-esp32/package_esp32_index.json https://espressif.github.io/arduino-esp32/package_esp32_dev_index_cn.json
docs.title: Esp32c3

docs.text: git相关 cmd命令 创建本地git仓库 git init # 也可以指定仓库目录 git init newrepo 该命令执行完后会在当前目录生成一个 .git 目录。 或者克隆一个仓库 git clone 添加文件到git暂存区 git add filename # 或者添加所有修改的文件 git add . 将暂存区的更改提交到本地仓库，并添加提交信息： git commit -m "Add new feature" 常见提交类型 init - 初始化项目 feat - 新功能 fix - 修复bug docs - 文档变更 style - 代码风格变动 refactor - 代码重构 perf - 性能优化 test - 添加或修改测试 chore - 杂项 build - 构建系统或外部依赖项的变更 ci 持续集成配置的变更 revert - 回滚 拉取 git pull origin main # 或者如果在新的分支上工作 git pull origin new-feature 推送 git push origin new-feature 先拉取(pull)再推送(push)!
docs.title: git相关

docs.text: git init # 也可以指定仓库目录 git init newrepo 该命令执行完后会在当前目录生成一个 .git 目录。 或者克隆一个仓库 git clone
docs.title: 创建本地git仓库

docs.text: git add filename # 或者添加所有修改的文件 git add .
docs.title: 添加文件到git暂存区

docs.text: git commit -m "Add new feature" 常见提交类型 init - 初始化项目 feat - 新功能 fix - 修复bug docs - 文档变更 style - 代码风格变动 refactor - 代码重构 perf - 性能优化 test - 添加或修改测试 chore - 杂项 build - 构建系统或外部依赖项的变更 ci 持续集成配置的变更 revert - 回滚
docs.title: 将暂存区的更改提交到本地仓库，并添加提交信息：

docs.text: git pull origin main # 或者如果在新的分支上工作 git pull origin new-feature
docs.title: 拉取

docs.text: git push origin new-feature 先拉取(pull)再推送(push)!
docs.title: 推送

docs.text: matlab 一些定义 函数 abs - 取绝对值and取复数的模长 floor - 下取整 fix - 舍弃小数位 ceil - 上取整
docs.title: matlab

docs.text: abs - 取绝对值and取复数的模长 floor - 下取整 fix - 舍弃小数位 ceil - 上取整
docs.title: 函数
